RUSHING down sheer rock-face in an area nestled deep in t woods. The apes have stopped to gather along the river at the base of the falls. Shrouded ape bodies are released i the river. Caesar and Maurice sit side by side, apart fro the others -- Caesar, troubled:
Why didn't I see, Maurice? Maurice turns to Caesar.
[See what?]
That Koba could not forgive what humans did to him when he was their prisoner. That he would seek revenge. I should have known.
[No one could have known how much darkness was living inside of him.] A SUDDEN HIGH-PITCHED ALERT rings out, almost like a bugl They quickly look up to --

where we discover they are far from alone, the trees comi to life as APES EMERGE EVERYWHERE! Hundreds concealed in CAMOUFLAGED GUARD STRUCTURES in trees and all around the falls. A LONE APE blows into a RAM'S HORN, as others communicate to the apes below that someone is coming...! The apes on the ground seize their weapons, standing at t ready, tension building to a fever-pitch when -- A SMALL GROUP OF HORSES appears through the trees... Caesar's intense expression suddenly changes, swelling wi emotion as he sees -- BLUE EYES, ROCKET, and TWO OTHER APES arriving. They look weary, caked with dust, their horses laden with enough ge to suggest they've been on a long journey. As they dismount, Caesar and a group of others move quick to greet them. [Hello, Father...] A huge smile spreads across Caesar's face and he embraces son. The crowd celebrates, rushing in to join the reunion Caesar turns to Rocket, the two happy to see each other -
Welcome home, Rocket. (grins at Rocket) You look tired.
[It was a long journey --]

Come inside! They all start toward the waterfall -- as we CUT TO --

Like a primitive castle built into the caves, completely concealed behind the waterfall and surrounding rocks. [Mother...!] -- she pulls him into an emotional hug. They both look do noticing a TODDLER (CORNELIUS) hiding shyly behind her le

CAESAR'S SYMBOL carved into the stone floor; around the symbol sit Caesar and Cornelia, Blue Eyes, Lake, Rocket, Maurice, Luca, Winter and other COUNCIL MEMBERS. A MAP is laid out on the floor; Cornelius presses his fac close, watching Blue Eyes' finger as it points to one spo particular:

Cornelia scoops Cornelius into her lap, gently pulling hi away from the map -- she looks at Blue Eyes, intrigued, points:

[We must leave tonight!]
[Tonight?    That's impossible!]
[How much longer can we wait?      Soldiers are getting closer!]
(touching Winter's arm) [Winter...] Winter shrugs him off -- Luca and the others all erupt angrily at Winter -- Caesar stands imposingly. Winter immediately lowers his head, afraid; then, to Caesar:
[Your son's been gone, he doesn't know how hard it's been!]
[I know you are scared, we all are, but we are still planning...]
Yes... We must still find a way to get out of the woods safely. Everyone looks at Caesar as he sits.
There were two of you. But we are many.
(concurring) [The woods are filled with soldiers.] Everyone falls silent.   Blue Eyes meets Caesar's gaze:
Father... We must try. Caesar looks at his son, emotional:

I know, son. (he turns to the others) More apes die everyday. And we cannot hide here much longer. Caesar looks back down at the map, deep in thought; then feels the anxious stares of the apes around him. He looks them, trying to reassure, though he is still uncertain himself:
We will find a way out... He raises his fists and brings them together, solemn:
Apes together strong. They return the gesture, nodding faithfully at their lead

A small cave in the upper levels of the fortress, enclose one side by the ROARING FALLS. Caesar sits up, awake, as family sleeps around him. Troubled, he studies Blue Eyes' map in his lap -- when suddenly he feels something... Caesar looks down to see Cornelius instinctively hugging leg as he rests, nuzzled beside his mother. Caesar gazes down protectively at his little one, strokes his head, th turns to look back at the map -- when he notices Blue Eye staring up at him through heavy lidded eyes.
[Can't sleep?] Caesar shakes his head, his worried gaze returning to the map. Finally, Blue Eyes reaches out and touches his fathe arm; Caesar turns.
[Trust me, father. This is a risk worth taking.] Moved, Caesar nods; he reaches out and gratefully caresse his son's face, then SIGNS, smiling:

[I am so proud of you.] (then) [I love you, son.] -- when suddenly a SHIMMERING GREEN LIGHT washes briefly both their faces... Startled, Caesar looks up at the falls to SEE -- -- THREE SHAPES distorted surreally in the water, each ha in green light as they descend rapidly from view. Unnerved, Caesar sits up, unsure of what he's just seen. Blue Eyes watches as his father approaches the falls wari moving in very close... when Caesar sees a STRANGE THIN L whipping about in the current...? He reaches toward THE LINE, mystified -- then plunges his deep in the water, grasping for it -- -- he pulls the line toward him... revealing a taut secti of RED NYLON CLIMBING ROPE, straining against the current Alarmed, Caesar immediately turns back to Blue Eyes and signs, urgent:
[Stay here. Protect your mother and brother.] Blue Eyes nods with growing concern as Caesar heads out -

[Sorry, Caesar.]
[How many others on patrol?]

[Get them!     Rocket too!]

Crouched behind rocks in the family dwelling. He gestures protectively to Cornelia and the toddler to stay behind h as he anxiously stares at -- A GREEN LASER BEAM slowly approaching in the dark rock corridor just outside their cave... a HUSHED VOICE:

99, target acquired!... Caesar picks up the dislodged headset, raises it to his e

fishing out the red nylon climbing rope from the waterfal it starts to clip the rope to an anchor on a belt --

Caesar crashes through the water, hands flailing for -- THE ROPE! He grabs at it -- IT CAREENS WILDLY!      Caesa on tight, looks up to see -- THE COLONEL high above -- clinging to the suddenly jerkin line -- he looks down to see CAESAR starting to climb up furiously after him... The Colonel, unfazed, seizes a KNIFE from his boot as -- Caesar closes in, climbing, about to reach him -- when -- THE COLONEL CUTS THE LINE -- and -- Caesar PLUMMETS -- down, down, down -- INTO THE RIVER BEL An excruciating beat -- then Caesar SPRINGS UP from the water, gasping, enraged -- he peers up in agony to SEE -- THE COLONEL disappearing over the TOP OF THE CLIFF!

CLOSE ON Cornelia and Blue Eyes, as their lifeless bodies lifted from the rock floor... REVEAL CAESAR watching silently, lost in his own world; s wet, he remains completely motionless, consumed with rage pain. Beside him, Rocket, Luca and Maurice watch, shaken, the bodies are carried away. Just then Spear pushes through, reporting to Luca:
[Luca! We can't find Winter.   He wasn't at his post.] Luca and Maurice suddenly exchange a worried look --
[He was scared. Could he have turned against us?]
He looks to Rocket as well -- but Rocket's gaze is now fi elsewhere. Maurice and the others all turn to see -- CAESAR has been following their conversation.     Finally signs, wracked with guilt:
[Caesar... I think Winter betrayed us. I'm sorry. He was in my command.] Caesar remains silent; then:
My youngest son...   Have you found him yet?
[We're still looking.] Maurice turns to the others:

[Let's help them search.] Everyone nods, following Maurice's lead as they shuffle o giving Caesar some much-needed space... Finally -- Caesar is alone. His eyes move to where he found Blue Eyes and Cornelia; t is blood on the floor. He steps closer, in a trance; sees TWO BRASS BULLET CASINGS on the ground. Caesar crouches, expression intensifying as he reaches for the spent casin -- when he hears a NOISE behind him -- on a hair-trigger, Caesar seizes the spear, raising it furiously -- so gripp by animalistic rage that it takes a moment to realize -- his toddler son, peeking out from hiding in the rocks; Cornelius peers up in terror at his father, shrinking bac Caesar returns to his senses, lowers the spear... then, softening, he bends to the toddler and extends a hand... Cornelius is still too frightened to approach, his eyes f on the spear in Caesar's grasp. Ashamed, Caesar sets the spear on the ground, then holds arms out to his son.
Cornelius... you're safe now, son.
The child finally comes, reluctantly... Caesar, growing emotional, pulls him into a powerful embrace. We HOLD TIG on CAESAR, pain etched deeply on his face...

location: RIVERBANK AT THE BASE OF THE WATERFALL

text: The entire ape community is here, urgently loading up the horses, preparing for the imminent exodus. HEADS TURN as CAESAR makes his way through the crowd; clutching a rifle one hand and holding his little son's hand in the other, fixed ahead as he crosses to -- LAKE, who stands by her horse, surrounded by Maurice, Luc and Rocket on theirs. Caesar looks at Lake. He seems stoi but his eyes belie heartbreak, and something deeper... tremendous rage:
You loved my son.    Look after his brother until I return.
(stunned) [You're not coming with us?]

No. Caesar crouches down to Cornelius, caresses his little so one last time, then guides him to Lake. ANGLE ON Rocket and Luca; they exchange a look, shocked. Maurice looms behind them on horseback, watching it all t
[Caesar!    You're not going after them?!]
Not them... Him.
[Caesar, you are our leader!   We can't leave without you!]
You must.    The soldiers will be back soon.
Caesar looks for one last time at his son -- Cornelius cr out as Lake tries to comfort him --
[Father!] But Caesar remains unrelenting, already completely consum by his dark, vengeful quest as he starts to head off:

(to the apes around him) When I find him, the soldiers will all come after me. That may give you the best chance to get out of the woods. Until then, be safe. And with that he moves straight for his horse. As the reality that their leader is leaving them sets in, the ap community begins to react in anxious protest -- shockwave HOOTS rise as Caesar mounts his horse. ON MAURICE, ROCKET AND LUCA watching Caesar amidst the growing turmoil -- they stare after him in total disbelie

A seemingly endless line of ape refugees. Spear leads the procession; armed apes in warpaint guard the group, paren protectively clutching their children, others help the injured along -- as they set off uncertainly for the peri journey ahead...

Caesar rides alone, rifle in hand, the sound of the ape exodus now barely audible in the distance. Suddenly, he hears RUSTLING behind him. He turns, stops, alert. As the sound gets closer, we recognize the CLOP OF HOOVES -- the MAURICE, ROCKET, and LUCA appear, riding out of the trees They come to a halt, eyes on Caesar. Caesar returns a har look, shakes his head. But Luca is undeterred:
[The soldiers' camp is always moving. My guards think they know where it is. Let me take you.]
[You'll need me to back you up.] Rocket reveals a rifle in his hand.    But Caesar remains
No.
[Please... I know what it's like... to lose a son.] That strikes a chord; Caesar looks at him, affected...
I might not make it back.
[That's why I'm coming.   To make sure you do.] Caesar looks at his three friends, moved, torn...
Riding silently through woods, close together. A posse. HOLD on this iconic image of the foursome; then CUT TO --
The posse making their descent, when they see -- SMOKE rising from an old shack across the way. They look at each other, slowing...
[This is where the guards thought they might be. There are always fires burning.]
As we move closer, we discover we are at the edge of --
Old campers lined up, long-since abandoned. Smoke billows from a weathered stovepipe poking through the window of a rusted-out Airstream trailer. The only sign of life.

THE MAN DROPS DEAD.   Stunned, the apes turn to s CAESAR clutching his SMOKING GUN, staring distantly at th man he's just killed. [Is he out here alone?]
[Maybe he's a deserter?] Caesar doesn't respond, eyes on the dead man -- when a MU CRASH comes from behind; they all turn to THE AIRSTREAM..

They stalk silently into the dim space, eyes roaming... I long and narrow, lined with rotted wood panelling, packed littered with improvised survivalist essentials. at the far end of the trailer. The others exchange tense looks as Caesar readies his gun -- and SMASHES down the d ON CAESAR, eyes blazing, furiously training his gun as he sees something; he freezes, poised to kill, and we REVEAL

cowering like a frightened animal against the wall in a l bunk bed. She looks no more than 8 or 9 years old. A litt waif-like figure, her unwashed face is framed by wildly matted hair. But Maurice remains, eyeing the scared little Girl with a mixture of curiosity and pity. He spots something on the floor by the bed, starts to move toward it... Terrified, the Girl scoots back against the wall, withdra as far as she can. But Maurice coos a comforting pant-hoo as he reaches down to the floor and retrieves -- A CRUDELY-MADE RAG DOLL. He holds it out. She hesitates - then quickly grabs it and retreats to her corner, hugging Maurice watches her, then raises his arm, reaching for he She freezes, nervous eyes following his enormous hand... his finger straightens... and gently strokes the doll's h
She blinks up, studying him, fear ebbing; she opens her m to speak, but no words come, just GENTLE, GASPING GRUNTS.

[Something wrong with her.   I don't think she can speak.] Caesar looks coldly at the Girl, then back to Maurice:
Come.

Instead she exhibits a strange, almost primitive fascination with his lifeless b They all gaze at her, uncertain.   Maurice turns to Caesa

We cannot take her. Maurice considers this, nods.

The posse on the move again. The Girl rides behind Mauric arms around him, her cheek pressed into his furry back. Caesar takes in the sight, shoots Maurice a hard look... crouched in brush, spying through the binoculars scavenge from the Airstream. Luca and Rocket are pressed beside hi

My son... my wife... are dead. Just then -- we hear the LAUGHTER OF HUMANS outside; Wint turns, sees SHADOWS OF SOLDIERS passing on the side of th tent -- he opens his mouth to shriek to them -- but a HAN CLAMPS over his mouth, as Caesar wrestles him to the grou to silence him! Caesar follows their looks down to the young gorilla in h grasp... and discovers he has killed him. Stunned, he stares at Winter's lifeless face... then, slo looks up again at Luca and Rocket, grappling with what he done. They lower their eyes.

Tense silence. The apes and Girl sit by a fire, isolated the trees; Maurice studies Caesar's face as he gazes into flames, deeply unsettled. Then Maurice turns to the other who look equally plagued. Finally, Rocket turns to Mauric

[Caesar had no choice!]
[So what do we do now?]

[Wait for the soldiers to leave.   Follow them to the Colonel.] Maurice turns again to Caesar, who is still in his own wo lifting a gourd canteen to his lips. Fire dances on Caesar's pupils as he stares at the figure, haunted... ...when suddenly, the Ape lifts his face, grinning at Cae through the distorting waves of heat -- Caesar looks haun
...Koba?
Ape... not kill ape...
snapping awake with a start -- we are --
Caesar catches his breath, lying disoriented on the groun when he hears activity around him. He turns, finding Maur standing over him -- he signs urgently:

A grand vista of Mill Valley in the distance. A SMALL ARM OF HUMANS ON HORSEBACK DESCENDS on the hills below us... OUR POSSE arrives in the foreground. Caesar looks with determination down at the humans as the recede... He urges his horse forward; the others follow..

Our posse are no more than DIM SHAPES pressing blindly to us, battling the elements, lost... TIGHT ON CAESAR'S EYES squinting hard, fighting to see... He peers into the maelstrom spying -- BRAKE LIGHTS up ahe

(tense) [Looks like they stopped!] Caesar urgently raises his hand to stop his posse --
[Don't let them see us!] He is already off his horse -- when DISTANT GUN BLASTS ec through the air! They all rush to the side of the road, huddling together -- as MORE SHOTS RING OUT up ahead --
(to Caesar) [What are they shooting at?!]
I don't know...

head_text.subj: A SILENT, UTTERLY STILL, SNOW-COVERED TRAIL

text: The blizzard has stopped. With a SOFT CRUNCH of snow, we see our posse ride cautiou into view, eyes anxiously scanning the trail for the pres of the humans... Rocket SIGNS cautiously to the group --
[They're gone...] As he approaches, Caesar sees something -- he stops his horse:

(unnerved) What is that...? As Caesar and the others dismount, REVEAL SMALL WOODEN X THE SIDE OF THE ROAD; they move toward the Xs to discover THREE BODIES DRAPED IN SNOW. Maurice tucks the Girl protectively behind him, as Caesar reaches down and brush snow off them... revealing THREE ALPHA OMEGA SOLDIERS, bu wounds in their backs, HOODS OVER HEADS, execution-style. Caesar pulls one of the hoods off -- the soldier is a WOM her eyes are open, lifeless, dried blood under her nostri Rocket pulls off another hood... a lanky, young, MALE SOLDIER, eyes shut. He too has dried blood under his nose Rocket inches closer to look at his face -- when THE SOLDIER'S EYES SNAP OPEN -- he GASPS at the sight of them The apes are startled as the panicked Soldier begins frantically scrambling away -- Caesar moves after him -- places a hand firmly on his leg --

Why... did they shoot you? He just stares back, blinking without understanding -- wh he notices the Girl, staring at him from behind Maurice. two lock eyes warily, like creatures in the wild. And the the Soldier opens his mouth as if trying to speak... but makes no sound, only GASPING GRUNTS, just like the Girl's
(struck; to Caesar) [He can not speak either...?] The apes all exchange looks; Caesar turns to Rocket:

Help me get him up... Rocket reaches down toward the Soldier -- but the Soldier freaks, wide eyes darting ferally, wildly scrambling on h back to get away from them -- Caesar moves toward him, tr to calm him -- but it only spooks him more -- he rolls on his knees and takes off RUNNING... The apes watch, stunned, as he disappears into the woods. Finally, Caesar turns back, looking at the bodies again.. and then the Girl. Maurice catches his eye:
[What is wrong with them...?] Caesar just shakes his head: I don't know...      And we
Caesar, Maurice, Rocket, and Luca urgently climb into vie snow swirls around them; cold, out of breath, they anxiou scan the colossal Sierra snowscape, stretching out endles around them --
[Where could they have gone?!]
Winter said they were heading to a border...!
[Yes, but which way is that?!]

The Girl sits on Maurice's horse, craning her neck all th way back to stare up at the apes high above; as she glanc back down to play with the rag doll in her hands -- an OU FOCUS FIGURE IN A GREEN PARKA silently passes behind her. CLOSE ON DARK, WEATHERED SNOW BOOTS creeping up and stopp next to the legs of one of the horses -- We watch THE BACK OF THE FIGURE'S HEAD, covered beneath t FUR-LINED HOOD of the bulky parka, as his unseen hands rummage stealthily through a saddle-bag. His breath steam quietly around him. He FREEZES as A FLASHLIGHT drops into the snow by his boots -- But the Girl remains focused on her doll, unaware. The Figure resumes rummaging, finally pausing as we BRIEF GLIMPSE the BARREL OF A SHOTGUN he has just found --

A NERVOUS SNORT comes from one of the horses below -- the apes turn to see the TINY FIGURE IN THE BULKY PARKA FAR B digging in the saddle bag; Luca lets out a TERRIFYING ROA The Girl finally looks up, startled, as -- -- the Figure panics, JUMPING ON THE HORSE, AND TAKING OF Caesar and his posse scramble down from the trees -- moun their horses --

head_text.subj: THE POSSE GIVING CHASE THROUGH THE SNOWY WOODS
GALLOPING THROUGH THE TREACHEROUS OBSTACLE COURSE OF TREE

text: The TINY FIGURE in the parka darts in and out of view The apes are starting to gain on him, when he BREAKS OUT the woods and up onto --

We watch from HIGH ABOVE as his horse CHARGES THE INCLINE KICKING POWDER INTO THE AIR -- the apes' horses burst out the woods after him -- all of them just tiny dots climbin the stark white landscape...
From this vantage we can now see the TOPPLED CABLES and DILAPIDATED GONDOLAS that tell us this was once A SKI ARE The apes again begin to close the gap --

head_text.subj: CAESAR CHARGING HARD, EYES FIXED ON --

text: THE DIM FIGURE up ahead of him -- when suddenly -- BLAM! FLASH OF GUNFIRE ERUPTS from atop the Figure's horse -- CAESAR and the OTHERS DUCK as -- CHING! -- the BLAST RICOCHETS off a half-buried GONDOLA CAR far wide of them! BLAM! BLAM! TWO MORE SHOTS ring out, wildly astray, kicki up snow clouds nowhere near them or their horses -- -- as the Figure disappears over the crest of the slope.

The apes arrive, slowing their horses as they come upon - AN ENORMOUS, ABANDONED VICTORIAN HOTEL, built into the mountainside. An old sign reads: The Inn at Deer Creek. The stolen horse wanders rider-less on the snowy front la The apes cautiously dismount, drawing their weapons... As they approach, a SHADOW SUDDENLY BOLTS from behind one of buildings, dashing into the main lodge -- The apes all exchange looks; then raise their guns as we

An ornate glass door   slowly opens... Caesar, Rocket, an enter, guns first...    As they pass us, the door swings behind them... HOLD    as Maurice and the Girl wait outsi pressing their faces   to THE FROSTY DOOR PANE -- their e fill with a sense of   amazement as we CUT TO:

head_text.subj: PUSHING IN ON THE FROSTY DOOR PA

text: Inside the lobby, Caesar, Rocket, and Luca creep away fro into what appears to be a kind of SURREAL ICE PALACE...
We MOVE with Caesar and the others, their breath steaming the cold as they peer around them at an extraordinary sig

Every inch of the cavernous interior -- from furnishings chandeliers -- is covered in THICK CRYSTALLINE ICE, the building having long-since been breached by weather. Snow swirls in the air, drifting down through a hole in the ro Caesar lifts a hand to stop the others as he spots -- BOO PRINTS in the frost on the floor. The apes' eyes follow t across the lobby's expanse... to where they disappear int the black opening of AN ENORMOUS HEARTH along the wall. The apes cautiously close in, guns trained on the hearth, deep and dark enough to conceal whoever's hiding inside.. Caesar stops at the opening; he COCKS his gun LOUDLY, levelling it -- Rocket and Luca COCK their weapons too... ... when suddenly, the STOLEN SHOTGUN is tossed out at th landing at the apes' feet with a thud. They stare down at uneasily -- when to their surprise the STOLEN BINOCULARS skittering out too. And then the COMPASS. The apes exchange a look -- Rocket quickly grabs the shot and the apes wait expectantly, weapons still raised, as - THE FIGURE slowly begins to emerge from the darkness, hea hung remorsefully, still obscured in the hood of the worn parka... He starts to raise his hands in surrender, and a his head lifts... we discover -- HE IS AN APE. A chimp with more skin than hair on his small, rounded he he has oversized ears and a little scruff of beard, his scrawny frame swimming in the big green parka. He stares up at our shocked trio with a sheepish, apologe smile... and finally, he SPEAKS ALOUD in halting grunts, pointing a finger at his own chest --
(chastising himself) Bad... ape... Bad ape... Our three apes just gape back, no idea what to make of hi Rocket lowers his gun. Then signs:
[Who are you?] But Bad Ape just tilts his head, not comprehending. Our a exchange uncertain looks. Then Luca turns to Bad Ape, lee
[Where are you from?] No answer.    Luca turns to Caesar.
[I don't think he understands.]
(to Caesar) [I don't recognize him.   He's not one of us.] Caesar regards the odd little chimp a moment; then SPEAKS

Are you... alone here? Bad Ape's eyes dart uneasily from face to face -- it's no clear if he understands this either -- but then he looks at Caesar... and NODS. A soft CREAKING across the lobby causes their heads to tu

stand just inside the entrance, peering back uncertainly them across the giant space. Bad Ape notices the Girl, SHIVERING BADLY beside Maurice. Ape considers her a moment, then lowers his hands -- Rocket lifts his weapon again, wary -- but Bad Ape just continues, removing his parka; finally he holds it out in hand -- calls out to the Girl --
Cold...? No one says anything. Bad Ape turns to Caesar. Holds out the parka, gesturing to the Girl with a tentative smile:
Cold. Caesar stares hesitantly at Bad Ape and the ratty jacket. Finally, he reaches out, accepts it from Bad Ape's finger
as Bad Ape starts A FIRE.

Warming herself by the flames, the Girl -- now in Bad Ape parka -- sits with Caesar and the others, looking around wonder at SPRAWLING PILES OF BAD APE'S SCAVENGED TREASURE beside the hearth, a hoarder's paradise of dry goods, can food, and an endless array of STOLEN ITEMS and TRINKETS. Bad Ape beams as he stokes the flames for his new guests:

I see girl. Think... you human.   But you... apes. Like me! He smiles excitedly -- when he sees the Girl picking up a trinket from a pile: a glinting CHEVY NOVA CAR EMBLEM. He gently snatches it from her, kindly shakes his head no.
(peering around) You... live here?

(nodding quickly) Long time. Long, long time. He suddenly scurries away; puzzled, Caesar watches him as rummages through what looks like a little sleeping area. returns with a small STUFFED CROCODILE, hands it to Caesa
(a wistful look) Home. Old home. Confused, Caesar looks down at the stuffed crocodile, fin embroidered on its belly: WORLD FAMOUS SIERRA ZOO. Caesar peers up at him, trying to make sense of this... t
Are there more like you?   More apes? From zoo?
(shakes head) Dead. All dead. Long time. He looks at Caesar, growing solemn as he explains:
Humans get sick... Apes get smart... Caesar nods, understanding he means the Simian Flu --
Then humans kill apes. But not me... (grins, proud) Not me. I run.
You learn to speak...?
(nods) Listen to human... His face abruptly contorts into an "angry human" expressi he waves a chiding finger as he mimics:
"Bad ape!    Bad ape!" Then, turning his head, he realizes the Girl has the shin Chevy Nova emblem again -- he reaches for it, possessive:

(gently admonishes) No... No touch. She stares at it longingly as he sets it down. He looks b at the apes, smiles -- then rushes away for something els The apes all watch their excitable host, perplexed -- Mau turns to Caesar, signs an aside:

[Amazing... Always thought we were the only ones. Wonder if there are others out there somewhere? Others like us.] Just as Caesar begins to contemplate the mind-blowing thought, Bad Ape bounds back in, hurriedly passing out packages of vacuum-foiled food rations (M.R.E.'s).

Here! Eat, eat! (beaming) New friends. Special day. Bad Ape tears the top off one, starts eating the dehydrat food, nodding encouragingly for them to do the same. Caesar looks slowly down at the ration in his hand -- not an official military seal: "U.S. GOVERNMENT PROPERTY: CA

head_text.subj: STATE BORDER QUARANTINE DETENTION AND RELOCATION CENTER"

text: TIGHTER on the word: BORDER. Caesar suddenly looks up:
Where did you get this? Bad Ape turns to him, confused. Caesar holds up the packa Bad Ape looks uneasy... his voice lowering to a hush:
Bad place. Very bad. I find. Long time ago. After zoo. Looking for food. Find human zoo. Zoo for sick. Engrossed, Caesar's eyes meet his... as Bad Ape continues
Big walls. Sick humans try climb. Bad humans kill. Then get sick too. All dead now. All dead. Caesar and the others take this in, somehow haunted.   Th
Bad humans...? Soldiers? Bad Ape recognizes the word, nods gravely:
Soldiers. The posse looks to each other with rising intensity...
[An old, deserted military camp on the border...?]
[Maybe this is where the Colonel and the troops from the north are going to meet?] Caesar nods: maybe.    He turns back to Bad Ape.
Is it far?     Can you take us?
(looks agog) Human zoo?! No... No go back there. Everyone dead. I come here. Safe here. Never go back! Caesar reaches out his hand, places it on Bad Ape's shoul
Please.     You must take us.

No!     Can not take!   Can not take! Scared, he pushes Caesar's hand from his shoulder, a litt too hard -- Rocket GRABS him, incensed В­- but Caesar restrains Rocket, shakes his head no. Bad Ape shrinks in Rocket's grasp -- then sees something, and points despera to the little windows along the wall --

Look! More snow! Can not go, must stay here. (to the others) Look, look! They all look to the massive lobby window to see it is in snowing hard now. Rocket finally releases Bad Ape.     He exhales, looks at with renewed optimism.

You stay here. Eat. Rest. (smiles hopefully) With me. Caesar considers, reluctantly nods to the others. Bad Ape relieved -- when he sees the Girl staring longingly again the Nova emblem; he grabs it, hands it to her ceremonious
Here.    You keep. He looks around, smiling at the apes for approval; the Gi gazes happily at the emblem, as with a WHISTLING HOWL, we
Snow whirling hard through the ice palace.        HOLD; C
The last embers of the fire dying out as everyone sleeps.

The only one still awake.    He sits up, eyes settling on THE GIRL, curled into Maurice's belly, hugging her doll; Nova emblem is clutched in her little fingers. Maurice's is draped protectively around her as they sleep.
Caesar stares at the sight, growing sad, his mind distant
Who is...? Caesar turns, startled to find Bad Ape watching him; Bad nods toward the Girl.
Child.
(a beat) I don't know.
(confused) But she... with you? Caesar nods.
She has no one else. Bad Ape gazes at the Girl, suddenly feeling sorry for her
I see you look at her. Just now. (turns back to Caesar) Look sad. But Caesar says nothing.       Bad Ape studies him; then
You... have child? Caesar turns -- Bad Ape smiles sweetly, expectantly... bu Caesar just returns a withering look. Bad Ape falls silen Caesar looks away. Then, quietly, stoically:
I had two.     But one was killed.   By human.
(quietly struck) Oh... Soldier? Caesar, still not looking at him, NODS. A silent beat, as Bad Ape looks down, pensive. Then softly:
I had child...
Caesar turns, surprised. Bad Ape stares at the ground, remembering, a little lost. Then slowly, he looks up.
You think... you will find him... at human zoo? Soldier? Caesar's eyes drift to the dying embers.
I don't know... Maybe. Bad Ape ponders this.   Torn, he finally looks at Caesar:
Then... maybe I take you. Caesar turns from the fire, their eyes meeting as we CUT

The Girl steps out alone onto the deserted porch, still wearing Bad Ape's parka. As she clutches herself against cold, something catches her eye; she looks up overhead at PINK FLOWERS of a perennial dogwood tree, poking through snow -- the only color in an otherwise stark white world. With the muffled crunch of hooves, Luca and Rocket appear guiding the four horses toward the porch. Luca notices the Girl staring up at the branch of flowers He watches a moment, then moves toward her... and reaches long arm up, snapping off a small piece of the branch. The Girl observes as Luca bends down, his massive gorilla face right in front of hers as he very gently slips the flowers behind her ear. She smiles. He blinks back at her sweetly, when -- Caesar and Maurice emerge onto the porch. Luca quickly straightens, resuming his tough guy demeanor. Maurice lowers next to the Girl, and she hops on his back He moves to his horse, and climbs up with her. Caesar, Rocket and Luca mount up as well, when -- -- the front door SQUEAKS open; they turn to see Bad Ape stepping out to join them. He wears boots, an old wool blanket on his shoulders, and a striped toque on his head

Caesar and the others stare at him, deadpan, but he is oblivious, looking from horse to horse, wondering where h supposed to go. Luca GRUNTS gruffly, points him toward Rocket's horse. Ape smiles, and starts for Rocket's horse. Rocket looks miserable as Bad Ape struggles to climb up.

The group silently weaves its way through snow-covered tr The Girl watches curiously as Caesar removes his canteen his saddle bag. Maurice notices her staring, follows her gaze to see Caesar drinking. Maurice grunts softly to her She turns, and he gestures at Caesar, making the sign for

[Thirsty.] (repeats for her, teaching) [Thirsty.] She just stares blankly at Maurice. He takes her small ha in his, demonstrating the way to sign the word. Caesar notices, lowering his canteen, quietly intrigued. Maurice demonstrates again. But the Girl shows no interes or understanding. Her eyes return to Caesar -- who for th first time softens, offering a sympathetic gaze.

The group have left the trail, moving through dense fores Caesar watches Bad Ape who peers anxiously ahead... to wh SUNLIGHT spills in at the edge of the woods. Bad Ape turn to meet Caesar's eyes, fearful:
There... Caesar looks at the light, then turns to the others, rais his hand for them to stop.
On foot now, the group presses in close behind the trees the forest's perimeter, squinting into the hard, low sun

Steep, snow-covered granite cliffs slope down in shelves, disappearing into an unseen expanse below. The TOP OF A MASSIVE, PRISON-STYLE WARDEN'S TOWER pokes ominously up in the distance, from the center of the chas Caesar raises the binoculars, PEERING AT THE TOWER: sun flares off the cement and steel structure, stained with corrosion. Through the windows, it appears to be DESERTED Caesar lowers the glasses, staring uncertainly -- when he notices something about the FADED CALIFORNIA STATE FLAG hanging from the tower -- he looks through the binoculars examine it: the flag is hung upside-down... and a HUGE "A has been painted in black across it. Then Caesar suddenly notices movement down below -- he sh the glasses to find TINY SILHOUETTED FIGURES, just barely visible along the edge of the lowest visible shelf. Caesar turns, looks from face to face... then:
[Luca, let's take a closer look.] (to Rocket) [Stay here. Keep them safe.] Rocket nods dutifully, and Caesar and Luca start off --

The HEAVILY SILHOUETTED FIGURES in the distance are still small, but from this closer vantage we can see now they'r the midst of placing a series of about twelve MYSTERIOUS, SHAPED STRUCTURES along the cliff's edge -- maybe this is some kind of defensive perimeter...? REVEAL CAESAR LOWERING HIS BINOCULARS; he looks confused he turns to Luca, lying beside him on the edge of a ridge
[What are they doing?]
(shakes his head) I don't know...
Caesar turns back, looking through the binoculars again, trying to decipher this strange activity -- when Luca GRU at him with quiet alarm. Caesar turns.
(points) [What's that? A patrol?] Caesar looks --
finding a PAIR OF HORSES on a ledge right below.

Don't see riders... Suddenly AN OUT OF FOCUS SHAPE RISES directly in front of binoculars -- Caesar drops the glasses to discover -- AN ALPHA OMEGA SOLDIER looming right above him, rifle rai The soldier pulls the trigger -- CLICK -- but the gun is jammed! Panicked, the soldier rears back, about to lunge forward with the rifle's BAYONET -- when -- LUCA DIVES PROTECTIVELY in front of Caesar -- -- taking the bayonet blade in his gut as he YANKS the ma down, WRESTLING him to the ground! They roll violently, finally coming to a stop, Luca atop the motionless soldie Caesar's eyes land on the BLOOD-STAINED BAYONET, lying in snow beside them -- he scrambles up, rushing to Luca -- -- when a SECOND SOLDIER steps out, startling Caesar -- a to shoot -- when -- WHAM! THE SECOND SOLDIER CRUMPLES, revealing Rocket behin him, having just clubbed him with the butt of a rifle. Rocket looks to Caesar, signs regretfully, out of breath:
[I saw them from up there... Coming for you...] They both turn immediately to Luca... who is rolling painfully off the dead man; he looks at them helplessly, GASPING, clutching his gut... CUT TO:

Waiting anxiously at the edge of the trees, Bad Ape, Maur and the Girl stare as -- ROCKET returns, climbing quickly up toward them, a grim expression on his face, clutching the bayoneted rifle in hand... right behind him, CAESAR CARRIES LUCA across his back, like a Vietnam soldier shouldering a fallen brother They all retreat into the safety of the woods, the group converging around Caesar as he lowers Luca to the ground. Emotion in his eyes, Caesar looks down at his loyal frien Fading fast, Luca smiles weakly. He manages to raise a ha holding it out to Caesar; Caesar grasps it firmly.

[At least this time... I was able to protect you...] Deeply affected, Caesar holds Luca's gaze a silent moment and then Luca releases his grasp, his hand drifting to th ground as the rest of the group looks on. Her eyes fixed the massive gorilla, the Girl climbs off Maurice's back.. The others watch, surprised, as she approaches Luca, clim onto his chest. She stares down, her little face inches f his... for the first time we see deep emotion in her eyes Luca peers up vulnerably as she removes the twig of flowe he placed behind her ear... and gently tucks it behind hi she begins to cry. Caesar is struck by her display of emotion. Luca smiles at her, then gradually his smile fad as his face grows still... and life ebbs from his eyes. TIGHT ON CAESAR, staring intensely at Luca, a mixture of and guilt in his eyes. The others watch him silently. Finally, Maurice ventures a SOFT GRUNT to him. Caesar tur
[I know how much you have lost... But now we have lost another.] Caesar just stares, inscrutable.
[Please... it's not too late to leave this place. To rejoin the others.] Emotion stirring, Rocket cannot hold back --
[Luca gave his life!   We can not turn back -- !] Maurice remains fixed on Caesar --
[Caesar...] But Caesar turns away. He shakes his head grimly; then utters quietly, consumed:
They must pay... Everyone stares, until finally, Caesar turns back. His ey meet Maurice's, whose gaze now appears judgemental:
[Now you sound like Koba.] Caesar turns to his friend, suddenly seething; the look i his eyes is chilling:

...Koba? You know nothing.   My wife and son were killed. (gestures to Luca) And now my friend. (then, harder) You call me Koba...?! Caesar glares at him, an unprecedented rift between them. Rocket remains still, taken aback... waiting... Then:

(trembling with rage) I did not ask you to come. Any of you. This is my fight. I will finish it alone... Go now. Join the others. Stunned, they watch as Caesar rises, and takes the bayone rifle from Rocket's shoulder... then heads off, back towa the canyon... HOLD on the apes' harrowed expressions, watching him; CUT
SWOOPING OVER Caesar's tiny figure as he scales down the vast, snowy expanse in the moonlight; he DROPS down to a lower shelf, and we CUT TO:

BREATHING HARD (O.S.), MOVING toward the CLIFF'S EDGE -- massive guard tower reaches up from the canyon beyond it ON CAESAR, air steaming from his nose; he SLOWS, SEEING - THE TWELVE MYSTERIOUS X-SHAPED STRUCTURES looming ahead - As he approaches we can suddenly start to make out DARK F STRAPPED to them...? Caesar's expression moves from confusion... to dawning horror as he realizes: the forms appear to be APES. He picks up speed again, rushing towar them, their backs to us -- it's unclear whether the forms dead or alive... Finally reaching the line of crosses at the edge of the cliff, he finds a GROUP OF APES, all semi-conscious, struggling to breathe, bound to Xs by their hands and fee Reeling, Caesar whips his head from ape to ape, trying to make sense of this -- when he HEARS A DREADFUL MURMUR RIS from the canyon; heart racing, he spins, staggering towar the edge to PEER DOWN --

at what looks like a ENORMOUS, FORMER PRISON CAMP at the of the sheer mountains, three stories below. As Caesar is drawn inexorably to the very edge of the cli OUTDOOR HOLDING PENS come slowly into view... INSIDE THE PENS ARE HUNDREDS OF APES, MURMURING helplessly... THE EXODUS HAS BEEN CAPTURED. Caesar stumbles back from the edge, overwhelmed, in shock He turns in panic to the bound apes -- suddenly recognizi SPEAR among them. He rushes to Spear's side. Spear looks like he's near death, his head sagging. Caesa lifts Spear's face in both hands -- Spear's eyes slowly o as they focus on Caesar, he can't believe what he's seein Caesar yanks the bayonet off his rifle, quickly cuts Spea down. Spear slumps to his knees -- Caesar crouches to ste him as Spear struggles to sign, still stunned to see him.
What happened?
[They came out of nowhere, attacked us... We were sure they would kill us all -- but the Colonel stopped them!] Caesar stares at him, surprised --
[There was madness in his eyes! He said they would use us, before we died.]
Use you...?

[They've been forcing us to work!] Caesar turns to look below -- when Spear suddenly gives o collapsing. Caesar quickly turns -- seeing brutal LASH MA across Spear's back. Horrified, Caesar lifts Spear up, holding him in his arms.
What... kind of work...? But Spear struggles for consciousness, his eyes flutterin closed... He begins to collapse -- Caesar is stricken:

Wait -- my little son -- is he here...? But Spear just falls to the ground, Caesar watches aghast when an APE FOOT steps right beside him -- Caesar turns, startled -- looks up to see -- RED standing ominously right above him! The BUTT OF RED'S RIFLE comes SLAMMING DOWN into us -- and we SMASH TO --
HOLD for a long moment. Hear the echoing sound of WATER SLOWLY DRIPPING. Then HARD CUT TO --

as they wince open, disoriented, in pain, his face presse the ground... A SHAFT OF HARSH LIGHT blasts down from abo Water drops splatter around him. Caesar peers around, struggling to get his bearings, his drifting in and out of focus: he finds TRACKS embedded in ground, a rusted-out TRAIN ENGINE in the shadows. The pla was a depot of some kind.
He glances up at the cavernous, curved ceiling; sodium va security lamps shine in through a rip, which leaks meltin snow. And then he notices --

head_text.subj: AN OUT OF FOCUS FIGURE LOOMING IN THE DARKNESS

text: a few feet away: it's PREACHER, tensely holding his cross looking unsettled as he stands guard... when an unseen VO comes quietly from the shadows as WET FOOTSTEPS approach:
Grant and Lee... Wellington and Napoleon... A SHAPE finally enters the light: it's THE COLONEL, who studies Caesar inscrutably:
Custer... and Sitting Bull. (then) You're probably not much of a reader. But this is... this is a big moment. This is... beyond... historic. Caesar glares up at him, rage welling...

Where were you...? (then) We came upon your herd... we got lucky. But I was surprised. You weren't with them. They stare at each other an intense beat... Caesar crawls menacingly toward him -- but is instantly YANKED BACK HAR GASPING, Caesar reaches for his throat to discover his wr are shackled and his neck is CHAINED by a NECK COLLAR... Writhing, he turns to see RED cruelly gripping the end of chain. Preacher takes a step closer, levelling his crossb threateningly; Caesar's eyes lock with his. The Colonel watches their stare-down:
I hope you don't come to regret sparing his life. He's quite a good shot. The Colonel just watches Caesar a beat; beneath the chill stillness of his eyes we sense something dangerous, damag
Have you finally come to save your apes?
(still in pain, seething) I... didn't know they were here. (then) I came for you. The Colonel searches Caesar's ferocious expression, surprised, something dawning on him for the first time:
I see... I kill somebody close to you that night...? Caesar looks him right in the eye, unblinking...

My... family. The Colonel stares down, some mysterious nerve jolted ins him. He comes closer, stands right above Caesar, looking him for a long beat, something about this revelation chur in his mind; Red cautiously tightens his grip on the chai
I'm sorry.     I was there to kill you. Caesar just glares up at him, the Colonel so close... Str the Colonel inches even closer:
My God, look at your eyes... they're almost human... (a long beat; then) How did you know I was here?
I was told you were coming... That others would be joining you here.
(a cryptic beat) Joining me...?
To finish us off... for good.
(he smiles) Who told you that? But Caesar won't answer. The Colonel just stares at him, then turns to Red and NODS:
Ok, let's go. Red quickly responds --
Ok -- ok, Kerna...! Red YANKS Caesar roughly to his feet; Caesar struggles, CHOKING -- as Preacher moves in too -- and we HARD CUT TO
MOVING with the Colonel, Red, and Preacher as they march Caesar into the frozen, desolate yard; Caesar steals a gl back at a CORRODED SIGN over the hangar: CA STATE BORDER

head_text.subj: QUARANTINE DETENTION AND RELOCATION CENTER, PROCESSING DE

text: As they walk along train tracks, Caesar turns forward, SE SOLDIERS huddled around fires in front of temporary barra killing time -- they stare up at him menacingly -- up ahe

head_text.subj: A PAIR OF GUARD TOWERS LOOM

text: More HAND-PAINTED SLOGANS hang on signs, recalling the cu like vibe of the base camp. Armed GUARDS stare down as th pass, straightening tensely at the sight of the Colonel -
Evening, Colonel!
(not even looking at him) Any more trouble tonight?

(eager to please) No, sir -- not anymore -- He gestures, and Caesar follows it to the LINE OF TWELVE bound to the Xs on the granite shelf above. The Colonel finally glances up at the Guard, eyes fixing critically -
You could use a haircut there, son. (seeing the other guard) You too, soldier.
Sir, yessir! Red jerks Caesar's head back in line as they start to pas

head_text.subj: HOLDING PENS ON EITHER SIDE OF THEM

text: Caesar looks into one of the pens... to see MASSES of CHA GANGED APES peering out mutely, shocked to see him. Caesa stares back at them with tortured empathy -- when to his surprise -- a change comes over their faces, and many beg to avert their eyes... a sense they feel betrayed by him. Stunned, Caesar marches on, devastated by the dawning realization his apes have lost faith in him -- when PLAIN SHRIEKS suddenly seize his attention -- He quickly turns to the other pen... it is filled with AP CHILDREN... they gaze helplessly at him -- when, suddenly one presses through to the fence, pushing his way past th others, terrified as he tries to keep pace with Caesar; Caesar is overcome by the sight of HIS SHRIEKING SON. Caesar nervously glances at the Colonel, worried he'll notice; he turns back to his son, shaking his head urgent trying to quiet him -- -- when the Colonel starts to turn... Seeing this, Caesar has no choice -- he quickly turns away from his own child HOLD ON CORNELIUS, watching his father walk away --

head_text.subj: THE DOOR TO THE ADULT APE PEN

text: swings open as the group arrives; Caesar peers in at the hordes of prisoners -- The Colonel nods, and Red HURLS Caesar violently to the ground, grabbing his leg HARD and shackling Caesar to the others. Red returns the key to Preacher -- Caesar staring up at t Colonel, who watches an eerie moment longer, then heads o The others follow. TIGHT ON CAESAR; he looks up at the ape prisoners... They stare at him coldly, and then turn their backs on him. Caesar lifts his head, stunned... as ANOTHER GROUP turns away... and ANOTHER. A quiet ape sound makes Caesar turn he finds LAKE in their midst, gazing back consolingly:
[Forgive them. We've been through much.] Caesar nods, shell-shocked, reeling...   Finally, he spea quietly devastated:
I will find some way to get us out of here. I promise...

(shakes her head, grim) [You don't know what this place is like.] The sound of crying makes Caesar turn; he looks at the pe across the way, where little Cornelius is pressed to the bars, helplessly reaching his arm out toward Caesar:
[Father...!] As Caesar gapes back, heartbroken, guilt-stricken, we CUT
We see the camp in the distance, nestled at the foot of t mountains; a dilapidated barrier wall stretches out from front of it in both directions as far as the eye can see.
TRAVELING OVER THE SLEEPING APES, chained on the icy ground... we hear the sound of DISTANT MARCHING, when a L HUMAN VOICE BEGINS SINGING out hauntingly across the yard a militaristic gospel tone:

Hu-uh-left... Left-right-left... THE CAMERA ARRIVES AT CAESAR, who stirs, his eyes opening the SINGING CONTINUES. PUSH IN on Caesar, confused, as ap around him start to wake up as well, a palpable anxiety spreading... he looks at Ape Elder who shakes his head, g Caesar turns at the building sound of at least THREE HUND SOLDIERS MARCHING in formation outside the APE PENS; he rises, anxiously scans the rigid faces, intensity burning their eyes as they march past the frightened, caged apes. As the SINGING STOPS, the soldiers abruptly halt, turning about face, eyes fixed upward; Caesar follows the gazes t
the "A" FLAG waving just below it. Chilled, Caesar watche as the soldiers all hold in fervent SALUTE, and the X.O. cries out, leading a MARINES-STYLE CALL-AND-RESPONSE:
Blood...!
We are the beginning...!

Caesar stares, unnerved, as the Soldiers' call-and-respon crescendos in OMINOUS CHANTS OF "OO-RAH!" as they gaze up the tower, where finally... THE COLONEL SLOWLY EMERGES; h shirtless, despite the cold, not fully dressed yet -- he stares down at the assembled troops, casually shaving the back of his head with a straight razor as chants ROAR bel A shrill chorus of ARMY WHISTLES suddenly breaks out -- Caesar quickly turns to see the soldiers moving for the p as the doors unlock, ARMED SOLDIERS enter and Red and the TURNCOATS storm in, forcing the lines of chained apes to their feet and into the yard with WHIPS -- it's terrifyin
watching the brutality; he stops shaving a moment, calmly pulls a FLASK from his hip, and takes a slow drink; then disappears into the tower again.

MARCHING gravely with hordes of apes across the snowy yar ARMED SOLDIERS pace menacingly atop FUEL TANKER RAILCARS along the side of the camp, keeping watch over the prison Caesar slows, suddenly struck by what's LOOMING up ahead

that seals in the front of the camp; it's unlike anything we've ever seen. Part of it is man-made, cracked slabs of weathered concrete erected side by side years ago; but a section, growing right out of the original wall, is ape-m

Massive tree-trunks have been fastened in a primitive but elaborate framework, into which huge stones are being set one by one. The apes have been rebuilding the crumbling w As Caesar moves closer, his eyes are drawn to an old slab cement, still standing in the midst of the ape constructi On it, "A" is painted in HUGE BLOOD RED GRAFFITI SCRAWL; next to this drip the words: "HUMANITY'S LAST STAND". Caesar stares at the words, chilled... as we CUT TO:

Caesar labors, just another slave in the sea of apes pass brutally heavy boulders to be laid into the growing wall, Soldiers keep GUNS trained on them. Caesar squints out at even more apes perched dangerously on the rock shelf abov the tanker cars, quarrying for the stones. Beside him, Lake heaves another boulder; Caesar peers pas her at the apes around them; they look WEARY, GAUNT; on t framework above, EXHAUSTED apes -- Ape Elder among them - battle to lift boulders on ropes. Lake sees the anguish o Caesar's face as he takes in the suffering, she signs:
[We haven't had food or water since we got here...] Stunned, anger fills his face; he glares up at the struct

[Why do they need a wall...?] Lake looks back at him, shaking her head: I don't know -- when Caesar sees -- THE COLONEL arriving at the work site; his Soldiers nervo address him as his eyes roam the wall, surveying the prog -- then fix on Caesar -- when suddenly a SOLDIER CRIES OU

The Colonel turns to the commotion -- Caesar turns too -- find Ape Elder struggling high up on the framework, dizzy with fatigue, losing grip on his rope as Soldiers and Turncoat Apes watch with alarm from below -- -- when he COLLAPSES, the rope ripping from his fingers - the rock CRASHES into the framing, KNOCKING DOWN a big section of the stone wall in a violent chain reaction!

Furious, Boyle spins to one of the Turncoats -- Red. Caes watches as he orders Red to punish Ape Elder; Red and the other turncoats pull the feeble ape from the rubble and d him into the yard, in full sight of the Colonel, where Re dutifully begins to WHIP the old ape...! Startled, Caesar looks at the Colonel, who watches the beating, unmoved -- then back to the helpless old chimp -

as he steps slowly forward in horror, pained by the excruciating sight -- the apes in his line follow, affect too... Caesar pulls himself up onto one of the tree trunk in the framework, stepping into a CLOSE UP, his rage star to boil... until finally, unable to bear it, he ERUPTS:
Heads turn, everyone stopping dead in their tracks as CAESAR'S BOOMING VOICE ECHOES across the yard... Even Red goes still, turning with the others to SEE --

GLARING back defiantly; then, he turns slowly to the Colo fury in his eyes, no concern for his own safety... For a moment, the yard is suspended in TOTAL SILENCE as Caesar and the Colonel lock eyes -- when, one by one, the APES START TO CHANT... Low and guttural at first... then RISING INTO A DEAFENING CHORUS OF REBELLIOUS HOOTS AND SHRIEKS -- as they defiant DROP THE STONES AND TOOLS to the ground! Surprised, Caesar turns... stunned by what he has started he peers around at the apes, to find them all gazing at h in solidarity as they chant... CLOSE ON APE ELDER still on his knees, clutching his woun watching in awe as the protest reaches a fever pitch... The Soldiers are at a loss as to how to restore order -- turn to the Colonel who just stares ominously at Caesar.. Eyes fearfully on the Colonel, a SOLDIER FRANTICALLY GEST across the chaos to Red and the Turncoats: get him!

turns as Turncoats and Soldiers approach (Preacher among them); unafraid, Caesar steps down to meet them -- his ch gang CHANTING protectively -- when the Turncoats GRAB Cae The Soldiers anxiously hold the others in check with thei weapons -- as the roar of the crowd grows even LOUDER -- Caesar glares as Preacher nervously unclips his keys from belt, tosses them to Red, who unshackles him...

watches as Caesar is marched into the yard, and thrust on his knees beside Ape Elder. The Colonel considers Caesar; then, eyes still on him, gestures calmly to the Turncoats The Turncoats tighten their grip on Caesar's arms -- and suddenly WHIPS Caesar's back with a VICIOUS SNAP! The APES' CHANTING SUDDENLY FALTERS as -- Caesar WINCES -- but he refuses to break eye-contact with Colonel, who stares back, a battle of wills... The Colonel nods; and Red LASHES Caesar again! Spirits broken, the apes go SILENT; beside Caesar, Ape El drops his eyes. Red looks to the Colonel, lowering his switch -- but the Colonel's eyes remain fixed on Caesar's, the two leaders staring at each other, neither giving in... And then the Colonel NODS to Red again. Surprised, Red hesitates -- then, LASHES Caesar once more, the CRACK ech through the silent camp. The Colonel coldly nods again; e Red is shaken by the Colonel's relentlessness. Red slowly lifts his whip again -- and -- WHAP! Caesar finally DROPS HIS HEAD, broken by the pain. GASPS ripple through the apes. The Colonel nods to the Turncoats, who release Caesar; he crumples to the ground.

...Ok.   Back to work. The SOLDIERS YELL for the apes to get back to work; but t apes just stare at Caesar, worried, as he lies on the gro Caesar finally lifts his head, his face now smeared in MU he looks at the apes, then glowers back at the Colonel, fiercely gritting his teeth:
Apes need food. Water. The Colonel glances at the apes, then back at Caesar:
Please.    Tell them to work.

(simmering) Give them food and wat-- -- without   warning the Colonel suddenly pulls his sidea shoots Ape   Elder dead right beside Caesar, then immedia places the   gun against Caesar's temple -- the speed and efficiency   of the action is utterly chilling. Caesar gapes in shock as terror ripples through the apes.
(an eerie calm) Tell them. Caesar stares silently at him, unflinching, trembling wit rage -- as the Colonel SLOWLY COUNTS DOWN:
Five...    Four... He tightens his finger on the trigger; but Caesar remains stoic, willing to die...

Three...   Two... And suddenly an APE by the wall quickly reaches out and p up one of the boulders, desperate to save Caesar's life - It's LAKE. The Colonel pauses at the sight, gun still raised... Caesar turns to see her, surprised... And then ANOTHER APE picks up a boulder. Then another... Caesar watches, distraught, as more and more apes pick up stones and tools. The Colonel finally lowers his gun. Caesar glares back at him bitterly.
(turns to Red) String him up, donkey. And the Colonel heads off; Preacher stares down at Caesar with pity as Red moves in... CUT TO:

head_text.subj: CAESAR BEING TIED TO AN X

text: The X has been erected atop a platform on the tracks in t center of the yard, for all to see; Red binds him up as Preacher stands guard... As the POV starts to drop, REVEA
Lowering the binoculars, in utter shock; lying beside him Rocket and Bad Ape, eyes glued to his expression. Maurice hands Rocket the binoculars to see for himself --
(warning them, fearful) Bad place... But the apes ignore him. He turns to the Girl on Maurice' back, looking for anyone who'll listen:
Bad, bad place. She just stares at him, blank-faced. Peering through the glasses, Rocket makes a low anguished grunt. Bad Ape turns anxiously:
What?    What you see...?
Rocket sees Caesar on the X, face covered in mud; the POV WHIPS to the MASSES OF CHAINED APES at the wall. ROCKET sets the glasses down, turns to Maurice, overwhelm
[Must save them! But how?]
[Must think! What would Caesar do?]
Oh no! They look over to see Bad Ape squinting into the binocula
(horrified) Why so small?

He lowers the glasses to look at them, appalled. They jus stare at him. Then Rocket reaches out and flips the binoculars the right way around, hands them back. Bad Ape looks at him, confused. He peers through again.
(finally seeing the crisis below)
Ohhhh...
Red finishes roughly binding Caesar, who looks haggard.

Alright -- that's good. Red turns. Preacher jerks his head: go. Red takes a last menacing look at Caesar, then starts down the platform. Preacher watches him go... then turns back to Caesar; he hesitates... then lowers his voice, hurriedly confidin

Look, I owe you one, so let me set you straight here, ok? I think he respects you, he does... that's why you're still alive. But believe me, he can do a lot worse than this. I've seen it. (haunted, almost a whisper) You do not want to agitate the man. Understand? So just... He gestures with his hand: back off. Disturbed, Caesar ho his gaze; then watches as Preacher descends the platform.

head_text.subj: BEHIND CAESAR HANGING LIMPLY ON THE X

text: We're looking out past Caesar over the camp, as exhausted apes are herded away from the wall, the work day over... diesel GENERATOR COUGHS to life, HARSH LIGHTS blinking on Caesar squints into the glare, weary -- when the SOUND OF SOLDIERS makes him look below -- at a group approaching f the rear of the camp, rolling ominous-looking ARTILLERY; suddenly concerned, he watches them head toward the apes. ...the fraught apes look alarmed as they see the weapons Soldiers coming their way -- then Caesar discovers even m Soldiers with MASSIVE MACHINE GUNS by the wall. Unnerved, sees them hoisting the guns up to the sentry towers... wh others position them on tripods; but then Caesar NOTICES

All the weapons are POINTED OUTWARD, BEYOND THE CAMP... Caesar is relieved; he stares at the weapons, perplexed - when he hears FOOTSTEPS; he turns to see -- RED climbing the platform toward him, gripping a long MAC with a look of cruel satisfaction... Startled, Caesar tenses; he peers around anxiously to FIND -- THE COLONEL eerily watching from the warden tower window. Chilled, Caesar turns back, bracing for the worst, as Red stops before him... He looks at the knife, then meets Red cold gaze. Steeling himself, he hardens, his voice hoarse
What did the Colonel promise you? You really think he will let you live... after we are gone? Red just stares, contempt in his eyes.

No matter what you do... you'll never be one of them. (then) You let them call you "donkey"... You are ape. Red raises his knife, examining it in his hands; he runs fingers along the edge... Then looks at Caesar, sneers:
Koba right. You think you know better... than rest of apes. But look you now. (his expression darkens) You nothing. Red SUDDENLY LIFTS THE MACHETE -- Caesar's eyes widen as

head_text.subj: INTO THE WOOD, AN INCH FROM CAESAR'S WRIST, HACKING THROU

text: THE ROPE -- ! Caesar turns to Red in shock, as his arm is set free.
(menacing, quiet) Kerna... want see you. Caesar looks back up at the tower window where the Colone remains staring a moment longer; then turns, and disappea
Then a DOOR IS OPENED, REVEALING -- we are --
The Colonel stands with his back to us, leaning on a map- covered table in the former window-lined control center, smoke rises from sage and grass smudge burning in a tin b

approaching the Colonel, who still doesn't acknowledge th as searchlights outside sweep through, Caesar catches a b glimpse of a room just off the control center -- it looks almost like a sanctum; light passes over APE SKULLS... th word "HISTORY" scrawled on a wall... then the room goes d again. Caesar looks unsettled -- his gaze returning to th Colonel, and noticing for the first time painful looking BRAND SCARS on the back of his hands: one Alpha, one Omeg The Colonel finally speaks, eyes still on the map: THE COLONEL

Interfere with the work again, and I'll begin slaughtering the apes, one by one. Understand? I need that wall. He looks up coldly at Caesar, then nods at Preacher: that all -- they start to lead Caesar out, but he won't go yet CAESAR
Apes... need food... water. THE COLONEL
(eyes on the map) They'll get food and water when they finish the work. CAESAR
Give them food and water... or they will not be able to finish. The Colonel looks up, amused by Caesar's audacity.

You know you're very emotional. (then) What makes you think you're in a position to make demands? Caesar doesn't reply. The Colonel turns back to the map - Preacher nervously tugs again on Caesar's chain --
C'mon -- But Caesar stands firm, eyes fixed on the Colonel:
The soldiers who are coming here... are not coming to join you, are they? The Colonel slowly looks up, smiles, suddenly intrigued - Red warily tightens his grip on Caesar's chain...
I saw men outside by the wall... preparing for battle... The Colonel studies him, surprised:
I was told you were smart, but... that's impressive. He stares at Caesar a moment; then finally:
No.   They won't be joining me.
They are against you?
They... fear me.
Why...? The Colonel just looks at him, silent.
Because you kill your own men? Preacher tenses; The Colonel holds Caesar's gaze, stunned
We found bodies. (then) Something wrong... with these men. The Colonel shakes his head in awe:
Jesus Christ... you are impressive. (then, almost enjoying this)
THE COLONEL (CONT'D)
Well, you paint quite a picture.     What you must think of me. CAESAR
I think... you have no mercy. The Colonel goes still, a deep nerve struck.    He DARKEN THE COLONEL
You came here to kill me.   Were you going to show me mercy? CAESAR
I showed you mercy... when I spared your men. I offered you peace. And you killed my family. THE COLONEL
(low, with contempt) Mercy. Do you have any idea what your mercy would do to us? Caesar stares warily, confused by the simmering rage he s to have provoked in the Colonel. THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

You're much stronger than we are. And you're smart as hell. No matter what you say, you'd eventually replace us, that's the law of Nature. The irony is, we created you. We tried to defy Nature, bend it to our will. And Nature's been punishing us for our arrogance ever since. Testing us. Even now. Caesar searches the Colonel's ominous expression...     T THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

Ten months ago, we sent out recon units to look for your base. They found nothing. My own son was a soldier with one of the groups. One day he suddenly stopped speaking. He became... primitive. Like an animal. They contacted me, said they thought he lost his mind, that the war was too much for him. But then the man caring for him stopped speaking too. Their medic had a theory, before he stopped speaking. That the virus that almost wiped us out -- the virus every human survivor still carries В­- had suddenly changed... Mutated. (peers at Caesar) (MORE)
THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

And if it spread, it would destroy humanity for good this time. Not by killing us... but by robbing us of the things that make us human. Our speech, our higher thinking... It would turn us into beasts... not unlike what you all used to be. You talk about mercy...? What would you have done? Caesar stares back, unnerved, challenged... he has no ans THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

Well, it was a moment of clarity for me. I realized I would have to sacrifice my only son, so that humanity could be saved. I held that gun in my hand, and I pointed it at my only child. (emotion in his eyes as he remembers) He looked at me with trust in his eyes, all he had left in his primitive gaze. And I pulled the trigger. It purified me. It made my purpose clear. His eyes finally return to Caesar's, who looks stunned. THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

I gave orders to kill the other infected, all of them, and anyone who might've been in direct contact, even if they showed no symptoms. We burned their belongings, anything that might spread contamination. Some of the men questioned my judgment. I was asking them to do what I had done: to sacrifice their families... their friends. They refused. So I had them killed too. (growing darker) Others with children deserted into the woods. One of those cowards fled to my superiors up north. They sent officers down to restrain me. They tried to convince me this plague could be dealt with medically, that up there they were already looking for a cure. That's when I realized: they had learned nothing from our past. CAESAR
(harrowed) You killed them too...?
THE COLONEL
What did I do, Preacher? PREACHER
(a beat, quietly) You severed their heads, sir. THE COLONEL

Except for the one I spared, so he could return to deliver a message: if they wanted to relieve me of my command, they'd have to meet me here, and do it themselves. Caesar stares, his eyes questioning what the Colonel mean THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

This place used to be a weapons depot. They turned it into a relocation camp when the crisis was just beginning. But the weapons are all still here, inside that mountain. (a beat) This is a holy war. All of human history has led to this moment. And if we lose, we'll be the last of our kind. It will be a planet of apes. And we'll become your cattle. Caesar just stares, unsettled; they hold each other's eye THE COLONEL (CONT'D)
Look at you. You think I'm sick, don't you. CAESAR
How many... will be coming? THE COLONEL

Probably all of them. Don't get any ideas -- only thing they fear more than me is you apes. They never questioned my methods when it came to you. He moves closer, looking at Caesar's face, his tone quiet THE COLONEL (CONT'D)
I didn't mean to kill your son... Caesar remains totally still as the Colonel studies him.. The Colonel's nearness is almost too much to bear...
THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

(leaning in even closer) But if his destiny was to inherit your unholy kingdom... then I'm glad I did. A sudden rage surges behind Caesar's eyes -- HE LUNGES -- The Colonel LEAPS BACKWARD -- Caesar's fingers GROPING FO HIS THROAT as he SCRAMBLES out of reach JUST IN TIME -- R
The Colonel HITS the floor, FLASK tumbling from his jacke Panicked, FURIOUSLY LEVELS HIS CROSSBOW -- SCREAMING -- PREACHER

CAESAR SEETHES, raging in vain against the restraint -- In shock, the Colonel gathers himself, picks up the flask self-consciously pocketing it as he stands, backing away he touches the side of his neck to find Caesar nicked him He looks at the BLOOD on his fingers with a rush, smiling breathlessly as Caesar strains, CHOKING in Red's grasp: THE COLONEL
So emotional! The Colonel watches, smile fading as Caesar finally relen THE COLONEL (CONT'D)

I can see how conflicted you are. You're confused in your purpose. You're angry at me because of something I did that was an act of war. But you're taking this all much too personally. Preacher watches as The Colonel steps forward, venturing closer to Caesar, seemingly unconcerned for his safety... PREACHER
...sir -- The Colonel holds up his hand to silence Preacher as he s right in front of Caesar again, eye to eye... Caesar burn tortured by the agonizing effort to restrain his rage... THE COLONEL
What do you think my men would've done to your apes... if you had killed me? Caesar looks up at the Colonel. The Colonel holds Caesar' angry stare as he starts slowly forward:
THE COLONEL (CONT'D)
Or is killing me more important...? The Colonel lingers tauntingly... finally, he turns to Preacher -- and as Preacher and Red move in, we --

head_text.subj: PREACHER AND RED MARCHING CAESAR OUT OF THE DEPOT

text: They head for the yard -- Preacher utters quietly, shaken PREACHER
Didn't I tell you not to agitate him? That was not smart, man... Caesar glances at Preacher, then at Red behind them; he t forward, speaks softly to Preacher, a hint of sympathy: CAESAR
If this battle is coming... you should leave, while you still can. Preacher turns to him; then abruptly stops:
Leave?     What are you talking about? CAESAR
You are not like him. Preacher looks at Caesar, taken aback -- maybe even offen PREACHER

He was right, you do think he's sick, don't you? You're just like them. He's not crazy. The world's gone crazy. And he's the only one with the vision to get us through this. The Colonel's a great man. He sacrificed everything for us. You can't judge him. Who are you to judge him? (darkening) I was trying to give you a heads up, keep you out of his way, I don't even know why. But if you think you and I have some kind of relationship -- that you're gonna give me, what, advice? You can disavow yourself of that notion right fucking now. Caesar is stunned.    Preacher raises his crossbow:
C'mon, kong. He glances back, nodding to Red O.S., and we --
Snow drifts down around them as they march Caesar through yard, past the soldiers' barracks, LIGHTS inside GOING OU one by one... REVEAL --

head_text.subj: ON THE CLIFFS JUST ABOVE THE CAMP

text: Concealed behind boulders, Rocket LOWERING THE BINOCULARS gravely SCOPING OUT the camp -- as Maurice, the Girl on h back, and Bad Ape arrive next to him, climbing down rocks
(worried) [How is he?] Rocket shakes his head: not good. He rises, waves for the to follow him further down the mountain. They start to go

Caesar waits grimly at the base of the platform, as Red unshackles his hands; Preacher stands guard, the X loomin Caesar looks up to discover APES gathered at the bars of their pen, unseen by Red and Preacher, whose backs are to them. Their starved faces are etched with worry for Caesa He softens, eyes settling on Lake's gentle gaze as Red continues to unshackle him. Concern fills Lake's eyes:
[You look weary.] Caesar looks back at her, then peers out at the MASS OF DISPIRITED APE FACES. Determination sets in; he steals a look at his captors, then signs discreetly to the apes:

[Do not lose hope... Some way, somehow, we will finish the journey to our new home. I will find a way to get us out of here.] The Apes return moved stares -- when Red hands Preacher b the key, and Preacher nods for Caesar to climb the platfo
Lake and the others watch as Caesar, weakened, takes an exhausted step -- and suddenly STUMBLES, knocking into Preacher -- who shoves him back, startled --

Get off! The Apes look scared for Caesar as Red yanks him down. Recovering, Caesar lifts his head, glancing meaningfully at Lake, then rises to his feet... Confused, Lake watches as Caesar continues up the steps - when she notices CAESAR'S HAND slipping behind his back - the hand subtly opens, Lake suddenly SEES Caesar is caref showing her something -- Preacher's shackle key is now concealed in Caesar's palm, small key ring looped slyly around his middle finger. Lake can't believe her eyes; with dawning hope she turns, points it out to the others -- their eyes widen, exciteme spreading as they watch him ascend the platform...

location: SNOWY CANYON FLOOR OUTSIDE THE PRISON WALL

text: Rocket leads as the group sneaks along the base of the wa They arrive at a spot where the wall has come down, steal look around the edge, peering into the camp... ...to see the apes in their pens, Caesar on the X, and between here and there, SOLDIERS on duty -- -- when suddenly they hear the sound of HOOVES approachin as a SOLDIER ON HORSEBACK exits the front gate on patrol, heading their way -- ! Panicked, THEY DASH ACROSS THE EXPANSE, heading for an OUTCROPPING OF LARGE ROCKS a hundred feet from the wall -
The group quickly climbs up, ducking for cover. Rocket an Maurice urgently confer, peeking out from behind the rock the camp in the distance:
[How will we get in?   Humans everywhere.]
(undeterred) [Must get in somehow...]

On pins and needles, Bad Ape watches them raptly, trying interpret their sign language; he sees the repeated two- finger-pointing sign for "get in", and the implication worries him -- he anxiously taps Maurice on the shoulder As Maurice turns, Bad Ape tentatively MIMICS THE "GET IN" SIGN, pointing with his two fingers at the camp:
"In"...?   "In"? Maurice NODS.    Bad Ape is immediately alarmed:
No -- no go in -- ! But they ignore him -- Bad Ape persists with panic, shrin away from them as he pleads:

Friends!   Friends! No go in -- no go iiii-- Without warning he ABRUPTLY DROPS STRAIGHT OUT OF SIGHT, disappearing into the ground as it gives way underneath h Everyone turns, shocked to see him gone. They scramble to where he just vanished -- surprised to find him hanging b his fingertips on the lip of a VERY DEEP HOLE! Rocket reaches down, grasps his forearm, pulling him out

(overcome with gratitude) Thank you, friend -- thank you -- But Rocket ignores him, SEEING SOMETHING in the hole. Rocket gestures to Maurice, who looks down to DISCOVER... AN OLD ROPE LADDER staked into one of the dirt sides of t hole, disappearing into the void below. Maurice and Rocket share an intense look, intrigued...
CLOSE ON CAESAR'S HAND, BOUND TO THE X -- we glimpse the still grasped in his partially open fingers -- when ARMY WHISTLES shriek through the yard; the fingers stir as we

REVEAL Caesar rousing from sleep; he looks frail, almost faint -- his treatment and starvation taking its toll. He peers around, sees the apes being CORRALLED from their pe He watches as the FIGURE OF THE COLONEL appears at the Wa Tower window; The Colonel looks down at a SOLDIER awaitin his command. The Colonel nods; the Soldier SIGNALS and -- TROOPS step forward with WHEELBARROWS and HEAVY PAILS. Caesar watches confused as the troops spread among the ap scooping out HORSE-FEED and setting down PAILS of WATER. The apes glance at each other, unsure... when one of them nervously HOLDS OUT HIS HANDS -- A Soldier dumps a mound of the dry grain into his palms, the starving ape immediately SCARFS IT DOWN. The other starving apes instantly rush forward with CUPPE HANDS -- as others begin to lift pails, DRINKING THIRSTIL AT THE PENS, Lake watches amazed. She looks up AT US, growing emotional, filled with gratit
[You saved our lives...]
